title: Ticket #622: DAGMan does not check node state consistency in recovery mode
description:
I just checked, and in recovery mode DAGMan does not detect any problem if it sees an event marking a node as terminated, if the node's parent is not yet terminated. In, fact, it happily runs the parent after recovery mode is done, and also doesn't complain that when the parent finishes its children are already marked as done!

I suspect that LIGO's problem referenced in the RUST ticket was caused by something like stale NFS handles temporarily rendering some log files unreadable, and therefore getting the internal state of the DAG into an incorrect state.
